knowledge_graph.config_saved: Configuration saved! It will be automatically loaded when the application starts next time.
knowledge_graph.no_connection: Not connected to database. Please configure and connect to the database first.
knowledge_graph.invalid_config: Invalid configuration. Please check database connection settings.
knowledge_graph.vector_dimension_updated:
Vector dimension configuration updated to 1024 dimensions!

Important Notice:
Due to the use of global connection pool (OnceCell), configuration changes require an application restart to take effect.

Please:
1. Close the application
2. Restart the application
3. Configuration will take effect automatically

New configuration:
- Embedding dimension: 1024
- Similarity algorithm: cosine
knowledge_graph.validation_found_invalid: Validation completed! Found {{invalidCount}} invalid items. These items will be skipped during import, processing valid data will continue.
knowledge_graph.validation_all_valid: Validation successful! All {{validCount}} items are correctly formatted.
knowledge_graph.vector_dimension_mismatch:
Vector index rebuild completed, but dimension mismatch detected!

{{result}}

Detected usage of old 1536-dimension configuration.
Recommendation:
1. Click the "Fix Dimension Configuration" button
2. Restart the application
3. Rebuild the vector index again

This ensures the vector index matches your embedding model dimensions.
knowledge_graph.bulk_import_completed:
Bulk import completed!

Successfully imported: {{successCount}} items
Failed and skipped: {{failedCount}} items

siliconflow.instruction_1: 1. Enter your SiliconFlow API key (will be auto-saved locally, no need to re-enter)

siliconflow.instruction_5: 5. System will automatically set multimodal, reasoning, embedding, reranker tags based on model features
siliconflow.instruction_6: 6. After creating configuration, you can continue selecting other models without re-fetching the model list
siliconflow.instruction_7: 7. To change API key, click the clear button on the right side of the input field
siliconflow.instruction_8: 8. Embedding models (like BAAI/bge-m3) are suitable for knowledge base construction
siliconflow.instruction_9: 9. Reranker models (like BAAI/bge-reranker-v2-m3) are suitable for search result optimization

anki.system_prompt_default:
You are a professional Anki learning card creation assistant. Please generate high-quality Anki learning cards based on the provided learning content.

Requirements:
1. Cards should aid memory and understanding
2. Questions should be concise and clear
3. Answers should be accurate and complete
4. Add relevant tags appropriately
5. Ensure logical and practical cards

api_config_modal.general_model_desc: Suitable for most standard AI models (e.g., GPT, Claude, Tongyi Qianwen)
api_config_modal.google_gemini_desc: Google Gemini series models, supports multimodal and high-quality text generation
api_config_modal.anthropic_claude_desc: Anthropic Claude models with safety-focused design and strong reasoning ability
api_config_modal.adapter_general_desc: For most OpenAI-compatible APIs (GPT, Qwen, etc.)
api_config_modal.help_multimodal: Can process image input, suitable for OCR engines or multimodal models
api_config_modal.help_reasoning: Has chain-of-thought capability, suitable for complex analysis, such as o1 series
api_config_modal.help_first_model: First Model is deprecated; OCR uses dedicated engines
api_config_modal.help_second_model: Used for AI conversation and deep analysis, reasoning models work better
api_config_modal.gemini_thinking_notice_desc: We automatically enable include_thoughts and a dynamic thinking budget so Gemini reasoning models can surface their internal thinking. You can switch them off at any time.
api_config_modal.deepseek_tool_notice_desc: When DeepSeek's API tools are enabled, the official endpoint disables the thinking channel. We turned it off for you, but you may opt back in if you're using a compatible proxy or want to experiment.
api_config_modal.embedding_model_hint: Check this if the model is used for generating vector embeddings (e.g., text-embedding-ada-002, bge-m3)
api_config_modal.reranker_model_hint: Check this if the model is used for search result reranking (e.g., bge-reranker-v2-m3)
api_config_modal.supports_tools_hint: Check this if the model supports OpenAI function calling / tools
api_config_modal.multimodal_hint: Check this if the model supports image input (e.g., GPT-4V, Claude-3)
api_config_modal.reasoning_hint: Check this if the model supports reasoning capabilities

api_config_section.no_api_configs_desc: Create or import an API configuration to get started.

gemini_adapter_test.title: Gemini Adapter Test
gemini_adapter_test.description: This test page verifies whether gemini_adapter.rs can correctly convert OpenAI compatible format to Gemini API calls and work properly
gemini_adapter_test.test_prompt_default: Hello, please briefly introduce yourself in Chinese. This is a test of the Gemini adapter's OpenAI compatible interface conversion functionality.
gemini_adapter_test.connection_success: Connection successful! API key and endpoint are valid.
gemini_adapter_test.basic_connection_test_desc: Basic connection test - Verify API key and endpoint validity
gemini_adapter_test.non_streaming_test_success: Gemini adapter non-streaming test successful! OpenAI format has been correctly converted to Gemini API calls.
gemini_adapter_test.non_streaming_test_desc: Non-streaming OpenAI compatible interface test - Using streaming interface to collect complete response
gemini_adapter_test.non_streaming_test_exception_desc: Non-streaming OpenAI compatible interface test - Exception failure

gemini_adapter_test.streaming_test_success: Gemini adapter streaming test successful! OpenAI format has been correctly converted to Gemini streaming API calls.
gemini_adapter_test.streaming_test_desc: Streaming OpenAI compatible interface test - Verify OpenAI streaming format conversion to Gemini streaming API calls
gemini_adapter_test.streaming_test_failed_desc: Streaming OpenAI compatible interface test - Failed
gemini_adapter_test.streaming_test_exception_desc: Streaming OpenAI compatible interface test - Exception failure
gemini_adapter_test.send_streaming_request: Sending streaming test request, using adapter
gemini_adapter_test.upload_image_first: Please upload an image first for testing.
gemini_adapter_test.model_not_multimodal: Current model does not support multimodal functionality.

gemini_adapter_test.multimodal_test_desc: Multimodal OpenAI compatible interface test - Verify OpenAI multimodal format conversion to Gemini multimodal API calls

api_config_section.title: API Configuration Management
api_config_section.no_api_configs_desc: Click the "Add API Configuration" button above to start setup

model_assignment_section.title: Model Assignment
model_assignment_section.description: Assign appropriate models for various AI functions in the system. Different functions (such as OCR recognition, problem solving, review analysis, Anki card creation, knowledge base embedding, summary generation, etc.) may require different types or capabilities of models for optimal results. Please allocate reasonably based on your API configuration and needs.
model_assignment_section.model1_desc: Deprecated: OCR uses dedicated engines (DeepSeek-OCR / PaddleOCR-VL-1.5)
model_assignment_section.model1_saved: First Model is deprecated; configuration is no longer used
model_assignment_section.model1_save_failed: First Model is deprecated; configuration is no longer used
model_assignment_section.model2_desc: Used for problem solving and dialogue interaction, any type of model can be selected
model_assignment_section.model2_save_failed: Failed to save second model configuration: {{error}}
model_assignment_section.anki_desc: Used for generating Anki memory cards, recommend selecting models with strong text generation capabilities
model_assignment_section.anki_save_failed: Failed to save Anki card model configuration: {{error}}
model_assignment_section.embedding_desc: Used to convert documents into vector embeddings, supports RAG knowledge base retrieval functionality
model_assignment_section.embedding_save_failed: Failed to save embedding model configuration: {{error}}
model_assignment_section.reranker_desc: Used to rerank RAG retrieval results, improve relevance (optional configuration)
model_assignment_section.reranker_save_failed: Failed to save reranker model configuration: {{error}}
model_assignment_section.summary_desc: Specifically used for generating mistake summaries, recommend using models with strong understanding and summarization capabilities. If not selected, will use "Second Model (Answer + Dialogue)".
model_assignment_section.summary_placeholder: Please select model (default uses second model)...
model_assignment_section.summary_save_failed: Failed to save summary generation model configuration: {{error}}
model_assignment_section.basic_complete: Basic functionality configuration complete, you can start using mistake analysis features!
model_assignment_section.advanced_complete: Advanced functionality configuration complete, you can use mistake analysis and review analysis features!
model_assignment_section.all_complete: All functionality configuration complete, you can use mistake analysis, review analysis, and Anki card creation features!

general_settings_section.title: General Settings
general_settings_section.auto_save_desc: When enabled, configuration changes will be automatically saved without needing to manually click the save button
general_settings_section.rag_settings_desc: Configure global settings for Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) functionality
general_settings_section.rag_enable_desc: When enabled, AI analysis will be able to utilize your uploaded knowledge base documents to provide more accurate answers
general_settings_section.top_k_desc: Number of relevant documents retrieved from knowledge base per query, recommended setting 3-10
general_settings_section.rag_no_embedding: RAG functionality is enabled but no embedding model is configured. Please configure embedding model in the "Model Assignment" tab.
general_settings_section.anki_connect_desc: When enabled, Anki card creation page will show AnkiConnect related features, allowing direct import of cards to Anki application.
general_settings_section.gemini_test_desc: When enabled, "Gemini Adapter Test" option will appear in the sidebar. This feature is used for testing and debugging Gemini API adapter.

api_edit_modal.reasoning_desc: Check this to indicate the model supports reasoning functionality
api_edit_modal.embedding_desc: Check this to indicate the model is used for generating vector embeddings (e.g. text-embedding-ada-002, bge-m3, etc.)
api_edit_modal.reranker_desc: Check this to indicate the model is used for search result reranking (e.g. bge-reranker-v2-m3, etc.)

enhanced_rag.page_subtitle: Knowledge base-powered enhanced retrieval Q&A system, intelligently search relevant documents and generate precise answers

enhanced_rag.library_guide_2: Default library contains all uncategorized documents
enhanced_rag.library_guide_3: Custom libraries can organize documents by topic or type
enhanced_rag.query_guide_1: Use specific, accurate keywords for better results
enhanced_rag.query_guide_3: Mixed Chinese and English queries are supported
enhanced_rag.query_guide_4: Try different expressions for more comprehensive results

chatStyleTest.summaryPoint2: Review common mistakes such as missing critical points and interval splits.
chatStyleTest.summaryPoint3: Consider sketching the function graph for an extra sanity check.

knowledge_graph.vector_dimension_updated:
Vector dimension configuration updated to 1024!

Important:
Due to the global connection pool (OnceCell), configuration changes require an app restart to take effect.

Please:
1. Close the app
2. Restart the app
3. The configuration will take effect automatically

New configuration:
- Embedding dimension: 1024
- Similarity algorithm: cosine

knowledge_graph.vector_dimension_mismatch:
Vector index rebuild complete, but dimension mismatch detected!

{{result}}

Detected use of old 1536-dimension configuration.
Suggestions:
1. Click the "Fix Dimension Configuration" button
2. Restart the app
3. Rebuild vector index again

This ensures the vector index matches your embedding model dimensions.

chat_timeline.title: Chat & Timeline
chat_timeline.desc: Streaming, chat data flow, timeline, and reasoning monitors.

exam_workflow.title: Question Set Flow
exam_workflow.desc: End-to-end monitors for sheet recognition, analysis bridge, render, and collapse states.

cards_template.title: Cards & Templates
cards_template.desc: Template studio, card generation logs, and chat Anki panel monitoring.

graph_research.title: Graph & Research
graph_research.desc: Graph auto-notes, RAG debugging, mistake inspections, and subject research.

input_pipeline.title: Input & Ingestion
input_pipeline.desc: OCR, web search, attachments, and drag-drop upload debugging.

infra_quality.title: Infrastructure & QA
infra_quality.desc: MCP/connectivity, layout checks, persistence, and automated testing utilities.

notes_editor.title: Notes Editor
notes_editor.desc: Notes module editor debugging and monitoring.

debug_panel.plugin_streaming_desc: Inspect streaming data/events with filtering, export, and sanitization.
debug_panel.plugin_deepseek_ocr_desc: Fine-grained monitoring of the DeepSeek-OCR pipeline: request build, model response, grounding parse, coordinate transform, and final result with stage/level filters and copyable logs.
debug_panel.plugin_irec_auto_note_desc: Run the inspiration graph note creation flow and verify backend state automatically.
debug_panel.plugin_chat_save_test_desc: Automated testing of 6 core chat save scenarios, verifying message persistence integrity.
debug_panel.plugin_session_load_flow_desc: Trace the full data flow from clicking a session in the analysis library to displaying chat history for diagnosing load issues.
debug_panel.plugin_session_load_perf_desc: Monitor timing for each phase of session creation/loading, identify performance bottlenecks, with timeline visualization and auto bottleneck detection.
debug_panel.plugin_exam_sheet_lifecycle_desc: Monitor end-to-end question set recognition events and backend calls; capture error details and raw responses for diagnosis.
debug_panel.plugin_exam_analysis_bridge_desc: Trace the full flow from question set recognition to analysis saving: navigation, temp session creation, save attempts, DB state, and duplicate-save detection.
debug_panel.plugin_exam_sheet_render_desc: Track ExamSheetWorkbench render counts and prop changes to diagnose infinite renders with per-render prop diffs.
debug_panel.plugin_exam_sheet_collapse_desc: Monitor collapse/expand state changes, clicks, and preview updates to find collapse issues with copyable logs.
debug_panel.plugin_web_search_desc: Monitor web search activation, invocation, context injection and source information with full-chain logging.
debug_panel.plugin_unified_drag_drop_desc: Comprehensive monitoring of all drag-drop upload areas with fine-grained logs including drag events, file validation, conversion processing, and callback execution.
debug_panel.plugin_anki_generation_desc: Inspect card generation checkpoints, streaming events, export attempts and failures with level filtering and keyword search.
debug_panel.plugin_template_designer_workflow_desc: Monitor template_list/get/validate/create/update/fork/preview/delete tool calls, mcp_tool block state transitions, and template render results with one-click copy/download logs.
debug_panel.plugin_chat_anki_panel_monitor_desc: Track the chat Anki sub UI state, actions, and event queue in real time to diagnose open/close or source switching regressions.
debug_panel.plugin_user_message_content_tracker_desc: Track user message content from send to render, monitoring contentParts building, normalization, and denormalization to locate text loss issues.
debug_panel.plugin_chat_anki_pipeline_desc: Track chat-to-Anki pipeline readiness, template injection, card parsing, and panel state with live event snapshots.
debug_panel.plugin_mcp_debug_desc: Comprehensive monitoring of MCP configuration, connection state, Stdio messaging, tool calls, and more with multi-server support and smart throttling.
debug_panel.plugin_stream_response_monitor_desc: Monitor all stream response chunks sent from the backend, accumulating and displaying them in a streaming manner without distinguishing between reasoning and content, making it easy to view the complete model response.
debug_panel.plugin_thinking_chain_debug_desc: Capture and display all thinking chain-related parsing, transmission, and rendering logs, including parsing process, Map updates, content extraction, and other detailed information to help troubleshoot thinking chain display issues.
debug_panel.plugin_graph_rag_debug_desc: Monitor the full Graph RAG flow: backend events → runtime → plugin handling → store merge → unified_sources build → UI, without relying on the browser console.
debug_panel.plugin_graph_edge_debug_desc: Track knowledge graph edge sourceHandle/targetHandle assignment, node side calculation, and layout lifecycle. Real-time layout snapshots, auto-detect edge connection issues, and export full debug logs.
debug_panel.plugin_first_round_flow_desc: Track first-round session creation, streaming start/stop, and autosave pipeline to pinpoint Stop-button or autosave regressions with level/category filters and one-click snapshots.
debug_panel.plugin_layout_debug_desc: Live-check critical layout nodes (content-header/body/page-container) for size/position/overlap/gaps to find layout root causes.
debug_panel.plugin_floating_panel_debug_desc: Diagnose floating panel positioning issues (RAG, MCP, Advanced Controls, etc.): monitor panel states, capture positioning chain, detect CSS conflicts, calculate available space, and pinpoint panel misalignment root causes.
debug_panel.plugin_notes_typography_desc: Monitor notes typography controls (font size/line height/font family) lifecycle: editor events, syncTypography calls, applyStyle execution, state snapshots, issue detection with one-click log copy.
debug_panel.plugin_layout_cutoff_desc: Continuously scans containers whose visible height is shorter than expected and highlights the cut-off area.
debug_panel.plugin_full_lifecycle_desc: Comprehensive lifecycle monitoring covering Memory Internalization(A), Graph Evolution(B), Parallel RAG(C), and View Switching(D).
debug_panel.plugin_graph_rag_lifecycle_desc: Monitor the complete pipeline from memory extraction to chat recall: internalization workflow → vector generation → three-way recall (vector+FTS+graph) → result usage, with real-time three-way recall details and performance metrics.
debug_panel.plugin_image_inspector_desc: Inspect image sources for each user message (image_base64, content, textbook_pages, _meta, etc.) and detect duplication and propagation issues.
debug_panel.plugin_image_preview_desc: Track the full lifecycle of mistake guidance image preview: thumbnail click → viewer open → image load, with automatic diagnosis of root cause.
debug_panel.plugin_mistake_chat_inspector_desc: Load mistake records and chat logs directly from the local database to verify saved messages, stable IDs, and reasoning content when the UI looks inconsistent.
debug_panel.plugin_chat_flow_tracker_desc: Track chat history flow from backend loading → Runtime processing → Host synchronization → Final rendering, including all field changes, image attachments, source information, etc.
debug_panel.plugin_chat_delete_render_desc: Monitor how many re-renders are triggered after each delete action, together with durations and chatHistory length, to catch redundant updates.
debug_panel.plugin_timeline_integrity_desc: Inspect reasoning timeline metadata for every assistant message across backend, runtime, host, and render layers to quickly spot missing or overwritten data.
debug_panel.plugin_timeline_source_monitor_desc: Listen to timeline stage events across backend→engine→runtime to diagnose missing information when data should exist.
debug_panel.plugin_chat_test_runner_desc: Comprehensive automated testing system for chat module: supports multi-turn complex real usage flows, records multi-layer data snapshots and flow processes, precisely locates potential problem positions.
debug_panel.preconditions: Open the inspiration graph and ensure tags are loaded. The test will try to enter edit mode and click "Create Note".
debug_panel.no_logs: No logs yet. Start the test to record each step.

dialogs.confirm_hint: Execute again within {{seconds}} seconds to confirm this action.
dialogs.prompt_unsupported: Input dialog is not supported in the current environment. Please use an alternative input method.

onboarding.analysis_intro: Click the Study Workspace icon in the sidebar to enter the analysis home. Walk through a sample question end-to-end and remember to save the result.
onboarding.analysis_input_textarea: Type your question in the input box. You can paste directly or type manually. The box auto-resizes, Enter sends, Shift+Enter adds a new line.
onboarding.analysis_attachment_button: Click the attachment button to upload images or documents. You can drag files into the input area or click to select. Images auto-preview, documents are parsed as text.
onboarding.analysis_rag_button: Click the RAG button to enable knowledge base retrieval. The system will automatically search your knowledge bases when answering. You can select specific libraries or use all by default.
onboarding.analysis_send_button: Click Send to start analysis. The system will first perform OCR (if images are present), then call the model to generate answers. Results stream in real-time with thinking chains and citations.
onboarding.analysis_main_area: This is the message display area showing your questions and AI responses. Expand thinking chains to see reasoning, click sources to view citations, or use action buttons to save/export.
onboarding.analysis_focus: In the main input area, type the question, drop images or documents, toggle RAG or chain-of-thought if needed, then hit Send to view streaming replies, citations and thinking. The textbook panel on the right can be expanded at any time.
onboarding.settings_intro: Next switch to Settings so every model and key is configured before you rely on advanced features.
onboarding.settings_api_intro: Manage all model provider configurations in the API Configuration card. Each config includes name, API key, Base URL, model ID, and capability tags like multimodal and reasoning.
onboarding.settings_api_add_button: Click Add API Configuration to manually add a config. A form will open for name, Base URL, API Key, model ID, adapter type, etc. Click Save when done.
onboarding.settings_api_siliconflow: If you use SiliconFlow, use the One-Click Create feature to batch-generate configs. The system auto-creates configs for Model 2, Anki cards, RAG embedding, and OCR models, then assigns them automatically.
onboarding.settings_api_list: All created API configurations appear here. Review the detail cards, run tests, edit or remove configs to keep your environment healthy.
onboarding.settings_tab_models: Click the Model Assignment tab to switch into the model management area before reviewing the remaining steps.
onboarding.settings_api_test: After creating a config, click Test to verify connectivity. Success shows a green notification, failure shows the error. Only tested configs can be used normally.
onboarding.settings_focus: Inside the API Configuration card, fill the base URL and key for each provider, click Test Connection, then assign multimodal, translation, OCR and other roles to the proper configs.
onboarding.settings_model_presets_intro: Model assignment presets save your current model assignments for quick switching. You can create multiple presets for different scenarios (e.g., dev/prod).
onboarding.settings_model1_desc: Model 1 is deprecated. OCR now uses dedicated engines (DeepSeek-OCR / PaddleOCR-VL-1.5).
onboarding.settings_model2_desc: Model 2 is for main conversation and text generation. You can choose any enabled config. Configs with reasoning capabilities are marked in the dropdown. Recommend choosing a high-performance model.
onboarding.settings_model_assignment_others: Other model assignments include: Anki Card model (for generating Anki cards), RAG Embedding model (for vectorization), RAG Reranker model (for result sorting), OCR models (for text recognition), etc. Choose as needed.
onboarding.library_intro: The Mistake Library keeps every analyzed record. Use it to search, filter, bulk export or reopen a mistake for further investigation.
onboarding.exam_sheet_intro: The Question Set Workbench lets you drop an entire paper; the system splits pages and questions automatically and records each run in the history tab.
onboarding.finish_next: Main tour complete! You can replay any page-specific guide from the top-right corner or reset the history in Settings to experience the tour again.

document_viewer.aria_reset_font: Reset document font size to default
document_viewer.hint_preview_download: Tip: Press ESC to close. Blue button for preview, green for download. If preview fails, download will be provided.
document_viewer.hint_default: Tip: Press ESC to close. If preview fails, try "Open in new tab" or "Download" in the top right. Cross-origin content may be blocked by browser.

aiContentLabel.label: AI Generated
aiContentLabel.tooltip: This content is generated by AI and may contain errors. Please verify carefully.
aiContentLabel.footnote: The above content is AI-generated and for reference only

aiDisclaimer.chatHint: AI-generated content may contain errors. Please verify carefully.
aiDisclaimer.cardHint: AI-generated card content may contain errors. Please verify before use.

userAgreement.title: User Agreement & Privacy Policy
userAgreement.welcomeDesc: Before you begin, please read and agree to the following terms.
userAgreement.mustAgree: Please read and agree to the User Agreement and Privacy Policy first

agreementContent.intro: DeepStudent is an AI-powered local-first learning tool. By using this software, you agree to the following terms:
agreementContent.aiFeaturesDesc: This software integrates third-party LLM API services for intelligent chat, note assistance, card generation, and more. AI-generated content is for reference only and does not constitute professional advice.
agreementContent.dataProcessingDesc: Your learning data (notes, chat history, files, etc.) is stored locally on your device by default. Relevant content is sent to your configured LLM API provider only when you actively use AI features.
agreementContent.userRightsDesc: You have the right to export or delete all your data at any time. You can manage data storage and deletion in Settings.
agreementContent.intellectualPropertyDesc: Original content you create through this software belongs to you. Ownership of AI-generated content is determined by applicable laws and the API provider's terms.
agreementContent.crossBorderDataDesc: If you configure overseas LLM API services (such as OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, etc.), conversation content will be transmitted to overseas servers when using AI features. Please evaluate whether using overseas services is appropriate based on the laws and regulations of your region. Domestic API services (such as DeepSeek, Qwen, Zhipu, etc.) process data within China.

contentSafety.intro: When using this software, please comply with the following guidelines:
contentSafety.rule1: Do not use this software to generate content that violates laws and regulations
contentSafety.rule2: Do not generate content that incites subversion of state power or national separatism
contentSafety.rule3: Do not generate terrorist or extremist content
contentSafety.rule4: Do not generate content promoting ethnic hatred or discrimination
contentSafety.rule5: Do not generate violent or pornographic content
contentSafety.rule7: Please respect intellectual property rights and personal privacy
contentSafety.note: Users are solely responsible for any violations of the above guidelines.

overview.title: Overview
overview.content: DeepStudent is a local-first learning tool committed to protecting your privacy. This policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your data.

localStorage.title: Local Data Storage
localStorage.content: All your learning data (chat history, notes, files, cards, etc.) is stored locally on your device using SQLite databases and the local file system. We will not upload your data to any server without your knowledge.

llmApi.title: LLM API Data Flow
llmApi.content: When you use AI features (chat, card generation, note assistance, etc.), relevant content is sent to the third-party LLM API service you have configured (such as DeepSeek, OpenAI, etc.). Processing of this data is subject to the respective provider's privacy policy. Your API keys are stored locally with AES-256-GCM encryption.

errorReporting.title: Error Reporting (Optional)
errorReporting.content: This software supports optional anonymous error reporting (Sentry), disabled by default. Only when you explicitly enable it will crash information and error logs be sent to the error reporting service to improve software quality. You can disable this at any time in Settings.

cloudSync.title: Cloud Sync (Optional)
cloudSync.content: You can choose to sync data to your own configured WebDAV or S3-compatible storage service. This feature is disabled by default and only transmits data when you explicitly configure and trigger it.

noTracking.title: No Behavior Tracking
noTracking.content: This software does not include any user behavior analytics, advertising tracking, or telemetry. We do not collect your usage habits, browsing behavior, or device information.

dataRights.title: Your Data Rights
dataRights.content: You can export, back up, or delete all your data at any time through the Data Governance feature in Settings. Since data is stored locally, you have full control over your data.

security.title: Security Measures
security.content: API keys and sensitive credentials are stored with AES-256-GCM encryption. DOM content is sanitized with DOMPurify to prevent XSS attacks. URL access is filtered through safe protocol checks.

crossBorder.title: Cross-Border Data Transfer
crossBorder.content: If you configure overseas LLM API services (such as OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, etc.), conversation content will be transmitted to overseas servers when using AI features. Processing of this data is subject to the laws of the respective provider's jurisdiction. Domestic API services (such as DeepSeek, Qwen, Zhipu, etc.) process data within China. You can choose an appropriate API provider based on your needs.

children.title: Protection of Minors
children.content: This software is designed for learners of all ages. We do not actively collect any personally identifiable information. If minors are using the software, parental or guardian guidance is recommended.

changes.title: Policy Changes
changes.content: This privacy policy may be updated with software releases. Significant changes will be communicated through software update notes.

sentryToggle.title: Anonymous Error Reporting
sentryToggle.description: Allow sending anonymous crash reports to help improve software quality

dataFlow.title: Data Flow Overview
dataFlow.localDataDesc: Chat history, notes, files, cards, settings — stored on your device
dataFlow.llmDataDesc: When using AI features, conversation content is sent to your configured LLM API provider
dataFlow.syncDataDesc: If cloud sync is enabled, data is sent to your configured WebDAV/S3 service
dataFlow.sentryDataDesc: If enabled, anonymous crash information is sent to the error reporting service
dataFlow.crossBorderNoteDesc: When using overseas API providers, conversation data is transferred cross-border; domestic APIs (DeepSeek, Qwen, etc.) process data within China

algoTransparency.title: How AI Features Work
algoTransparency.ragDesc: When you reference files or notes in a conversation, the system vectorizes the content and stores it in a local vector database. It retrieves semantically relevant content fragments and sends them as context to the AI model for more accurate responses.
algoTransparency.memoryDesc: The memory system records your learning preferences and knowledge points for personalized conversations. When privacy mode is enabled, memory content is not sent to external AI services.
algoTransparency.cardGenDesc: The card generation feature uses AI to extract key knowledge points from your learning materials and automatically generates Anki-format memory cards. Generated card content comes from the AI model and may require manual verification.

dataRights.manageDataDesc: Export, back up, or delete all your data

conversation.import_success_description: Conversation {{id}} imported. Check the chat list.
